title: Hillsboro Roubaix 2008
description: Hillsboro-Roubaix is a Spring Classic-style road race in rural Illinois and includes windswept, open roads, narrow twisting country backroads, and a section paved in brick.  It\'s a favorite spring race in the Midwest.  Headquarters is the Hillsboro Free Methodist Church.  This race primarily benefits the Montgomery County Cancer Association, a local grassroots group who serve local residents and clinics.
course: The course is 22 miles long and has a mix of road surfaces and conditions.  Hills are short but challenging.
registration: Racers will be able to register at www.2wheeltech.com in advance of the race and pre-pay their entries.  If there are spots left over, we will register racers on race day starting at 8:30 AM.
directions:
Hillsboro Illinois is 60 miles NE of St. Louis, MO.
From St. Louis: Take 64 East to 55 North.  Go 50 miles to IL-16, the Gillespie/Litchfield exit.  

From Northern Illinois:  Take 55 South to IL-16, Gillespie/Litchfield exit.

From I-55: Go 10 miles east on IL-16 to Hillsboro.  Turn South on Main Street 9follow road as it winds).  After the McDonald\'s, look for traffic light at West Fairground Avenue and turn right.  Continue to Seymour, turn left, and park in the Hillsboro Free Methodist Church Parking lot, toward the back.

Grayslake Cycling Classic at Prairie Crossing

address.street: The Village Green at Prairie Crossing Community, Grayslake Illinois

description: The 3rd Annual Grayslake Cycling Classic at Prairie Crossing
course: Nestled tightly within the Prairie Crossing community in Grayslake, IL, this criterium is about 1.1 miles long with a fast layout. The course consists of straight sections, soft-sweeping 90s, plus two hard 90 degree turns, and a sweeping 180 degree turn just 100 meters from the start/finish. The Village Green is in the center of all the action, and provides plenty of room for spectators and sponsors to spread out.
registration:
Opens day of race at 7:30AM at
north end of course on Prairie Trail and Potawatomi Rd.  and closes 15 minutes before each race. Or
register online at
www.grayslakebikerace.com
notes:
Free lap rule in effect. Wheels
in/wheels out. Part of the Illinois Cup
Series points race and held under
USA Cycling Permit.
directions:
From Chicago take I-94 west to IL Rte
137 Buckley Rd, go west to US Rte
45. North to Jones Point Road, go
left into Prairie Crossing Community.
From Milwaukee take I-94 east to IL-
21 Milwaukee Road, exit just past
Great America. Go right/south to IL
Rte 120. West on 120 to US 45,
south to Jones Point Road, go right
into Prairie Crossing Community.

Enter Prairie Crossing at Jones Point Rd and US 45 
Near IL Rte 120 & US45 in Grayslake, IL
